arts.ttl: Ange Postecoglou repeats transfer message after latest Tottenham loss
arts.sum: I certainly haven't lost belief or determination to turn it around and the players showed in the second half that they haven't either." Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou insisted his belief in his project is unwavering despite Sunday's crushing defeat at Everton, but admitted new signings are vital to turn things around.

arts.ttl: How Moyes' Everton frustrated Tottenham - analysis
arts.sum: Match Of The Day 2 pundits Leon Osman and Farah Williams analyse Everton's 3-2 victory over Tottenham - and discuss what manager Ange Postecoglu can do to turn around Spurs' form.

arts.ttl: FPL notes: Solanke + Johnson injuries, Everton’s change of shape
arts.sum: Wins for Everton and Nottingham Forest get the Scout Notes treatment The post FPL notes: Solanke + Johnson injuries, Everton’s change of shape appeared first on Best FPL Tips, Advice, Team News, Picks, and Statistics from Fantasy Football Scout.

arts.ttl: 'Aggression, energy, desire' - how Moyes is motivating Everton, again
arts.sum: Former Everton midfielder Leon Osman explains how David Moyes' determination rubs off on his players, and why Sunday's win over Tottenham had hallmarks of his best Toffees teams.

arts.ttl: Moyes praises Calvert-Lewin & Ndiaye after beating Spurs
arts.sum: David Moyes praises Dominic Calvert-Lewin and Iliman Ndiaye, who both scored in Everton's 3-2 win against Tottenham Hotspur.

arts.ttl: James Maddison's brutally honest Tottenham assessment as pressure grows on Ange Postecoglou
arts.sum: Ange Postecgolou's Tottenham suffered a fifth defeat in their last six Premier League matches and midfielder James Maddison gave an honest verdict after the loss at Everton

arts.ttl: Everton hold off late Spurs fightback to give Moyes a first win
arts.sum: Moyes’ side struck twice inside the opening 30 minutes, with Calvert-Lewin netting his first goal in 16 league games before Ndiaye’s fine individual effort doubled their lead. Ndiaye’s moment of individual quality doubled the advantage and when Gray put through his own net, Everton led a Premier League game at half-time by three goals for the first time in nearly eight years.

arts.ttl: Ange Postecoglou clashes with reporter in awkward interview after Tottenham defeat
arts.sum: Ange Postecoglou's behaviour in his post-match interview with the BBC following Tottenham's damaging 3-2 defeat at Everton at Goodison Park has been criticised by fans

arts.ttl: Tottenham fans turn at Goodison Park as continued chants make it clear what they want to happen now
arts.sum: Tottenham were well beaten by Everton despite the final score-line being 3-2 and Spurs fans made it clear throughout the game where their allegiances lie...

arts.ttl: Furious Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou snaps back at BBC reporter over their season's struggles with a sarcastic remark after his side's dismal 3-2 defeat by Everton
arts.sum: Angry Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou snapped back at a BBC reporter following his side's 3-2 defeat by Everton. Postecoglou's side are in 15th place in the Premier League.
